title: Delhi
summary: Delhi, officially the National Capital Territory of Delhi (NCT), is a city and a union territory of India containing New Delhi, the capital of India.

value.label: There is evidence of continuous inhabitation in Delhi since at least the 6th century BCE. The earliest architectural relics date back to the Maurya period. Remains of eight major cities have been discovered in Delhi.
Foundation of the Delhi Sultanate was laid. Delhi was a major centre of Sufism during this period.
Babur invaded India and founded the Mughal Empire that ruled from Delhi and Agra.
During the sepoy mutiny of 1857, Delhi fell to the forces of East India Company after a fight known as the Siege of Delhi. The city came under the direct control of the British Government in 1858.

value.label: Delhi is situated in the northern part of India, on the banks of the River Yamuna.
